error.signature: ERROR: Failed to build installable wheels for some pyproject.toml based projects (build isolation)

verdict.summary: Build isolation creates a temporary virtualenv for building. Fails when build dependencies cannot be resolved or installed in the isolated environment, often due to missing system libraries or circular dependencies.

dead_ends.why_fails: Disabling build isolation can cause dependency pollution and break other packages that require clean builds

dead_ends.action: Downgrade pip to avoid build isolation
dead_ends.why_fails: Old pip versions have worse dependency resolution and more bugs; build isolation is there for good reason

workarounds.action: Install build dependencies first, then use --no-build-isolation for the specific package
workarounds.how: pip install setuptools wheel cython numpy && pip install --no-build-isolation <package>

workarounds.action: Install required system libraries for compilation (e.g., libffi-dev, python3-dev)
workarounds.how: apt-get install build-essential python3-dev libffi-dev && pip install <package>
workarounds.condition: when the build requires C extensions

leads_to.condition: when build isolation partially works but compilation fails

preceded_by.condition: when metadata extraction triggers a build

frequently_confused_with.distinction: Build isolation failure is about the isolated build environment setup; src-install-failed is about the actual compilation or install step after environment setup
